More specifically, explaining with reference to FIG. 31, because the process in step ST3108 is not performed, steps ST3109 to ST3113 can be eliminated. Therefore, the problem 4 can be solved.

Further, because the current technique about “expired CSG subscriptions” in the network side is used in the solution provided by this Embodiment 7, there can be provided an advantage of being able to solve the problem 4 while preventing an increase in the load imposed on the network. As a result, there can be provided an advantage of preventing the mobile communication system from increasing in complexity.

This Embodiment 7 can be used in combination with Embodiment 1, Variant 1 of Embodiment 1, Embodiment 2, Variant 1 of Embodiment 2, Embodiment 3, Variant 1 of Embodiment 3, Variant 2 of Embodiment 3, Embodiment 4, Variant 1 of Embodiment 4, Variant 2 of Embodiment 4, Embodiment 5, Variant 1 of Embodiment 5, Embodiment 6, or Variant 1 of Embodiment 6. Variant 1 of Embodiment 7
Because a problem to be solved by Variant 1 of Embodiment 7 is the same as that by Embodiment 7, the explanation of the problem is omitted hereafter.

A solution provided by Variant 1 of Embodiment 7 is shown below. When a CSG member subscription is canceled, the network manages the CSG ID for the mobile terminal as a “canceled CSG subscription”, independently from expired CSG subscriptions. Further, canceled CSG subscriptions are handled as valid CSG subscriptions for the paging optimisation. As a result, the paging optimisation is not carried out on a paging destined for the mobile terminal also when a CSG member subscription is canceled. More specifically, explaining with reference to FIG. 31, because the process in step ST3108 is not performed, steps ST3109 to ST3113 can be eliminated. Therefore, the problem 4 can be solved.

Further, in accordance with the solution provided by this Variant 1 of Embodiment 7, because “cancelled CSG subscriptions” are managed and controlled independently of the conventional management of “expired CSG subscriptions” by the network side, there can be provided an advantage of being able to deal with a change in the specifications of the mobile communication system, and so on with flexibility.

Embodiment 1, Variant 1 of Embodiment 1, Embodiment 2, Variant 1 of Embodiment 2, Embodiment 3, Variant 1 of Embodiment 3, Variant 2 of Embodiment 3, Embodiment 4, Variant 1 of Embodiment 4, Variant 2 of Embodiment 4, Embodiment 5, Variant 1 of Embodiment 5, Embodiment 6, or Variant 1 of Embodiment 6 can be applied to “cancelled CSG subscriptions” according to Variant 1 of this Embodiment 7.

Although the communication system using the LTE method in which a Home-eNB is used as a CSG cell is shown above, the present invention can also be applied to a communication system using a UMTS method in which a Home-NB is used as a CSG cell.

In the communication system using the UMTS method in which a Home-NB is used as a CSG cell, an RNC is disposed between a base station (Home-NB or NB) and a core network, and an RRC message, such as an RRC connection request, has only to be transmitted and received between a mobile terminal and the RNC and a NAS message, such as a TAU request, has only to be transmitted from the mobile terminal to the core network through the base station (Home-NB or NB) and the RNC. By constructing the communication system in this way, the present invention can also be applied to the communication system using the UMTS method in which a Home-NB is used as a CSG cell.

claim.claim-text: 1. A mobile communication system which includes a mobile terminal, a base station which carries out radio communications with said mobile terminal, and an access management device which manages access from said mobile terminal to said base station, and which, when an access group comprised of one or more mobile terminals and one or more base stations is registered with the access management device, grants a mobile terminal included in said access group permission to access to a base station included in the same access group, wherein when a predetermined condition is satisfied after a mobile terminal subscribes to said access group in such a way that the mobile terminal is granted permission to temporarily access to said access group during an access permit period, and this access permit period expires, said mobile communication system excludes the mobile terminal for which said access permit period has expired from destinations to which a calling message is transmitted through a base station included in the same access group.

2. The mobile communication system according to claim 1, wherein said predetermined condition is that a request signal for notifying a request to access from the mobile terminal to the base station is transmitted from said mobile terminal to said base station, and a reject signal for rejecting said request signal is transmitted from said base station to said mobile terminal.
3. The mobile communication system according to claim 1, wherein said predetermined condition is that a predetermined time has elapsed after expiration of the access permit period.

4. The mobile communication system according to claim 1, wherein the mobile terminal includes an access control unit for managing an access group to which the mobile terminal is granted permission to access by said access management device, and, when the predetermined condition is satisfied, said access control unit cancels registration of the access group in the mobile terminal.

5. The mobile communication system according to claim 4, wherein said predetermined condition is that it is determined that a local access permit period associated with the access permit period has expired.

6. The mobile communication system according to claim 4, wherein said predetermined condition is that when it is determined that said local access permit period has expired, the mobile terminal makes a request of the access management device to notify a status of subscriptions to the access group and then receives a notification showing that said mobile terminal is not included in said access group.
7. The mobile communication system according to claim 5 or 6, wherein said local access permit period is equal to said access permit period.

8. The mobile communication system according to claim 4, wherein said predetermined condition is that when it is determined that there is a change in a status of subscriptions to the access group in said access management device, the status of the subscription to said access group is notified from said access management device to the mobile terminal and the mobile terminal receives a notification showing that said mobile terminal is not included in said access group.

9. The mobile communication system according to claim 8, wherein the access management device notifies the mobile terminal that the status of subscriptions to the access group has been changed, and, after that, notifies a changed description of the subscriptions to the mobile terminal by using a connection which is established.
10. The mobile communication system according to claim 9, wherein said mobile communication system notifies a description about the change in the changed description of the subscriptions.

11. The mobile communication system according to claim 1, wherein a status of subscriptions to the access group is notified from the access management device to the mobile terminal through a base station other than the one or more base stations included in said access group.

12. The mobile communication system according to claim 1, wherein the mobile terminal which subscribes to the access group in such a way that the mobile terminal is granted permission to temporarily access to the access group during the access permit period periodically updates a tracking area which is an area where a paging message is transmitted.

13. The mobile communication system according to claim 12, wherein the mobile terminal periodically updates the tracking area even when no information for commanding the mobile terminal to perform a periodic update of the tracking area is included in system information.

14. The mobile communication system according to claim 12, wherein in addition to normal periods at which to update the tracking area for a mobile terminal, periods at which to update a tracking area for a mobile terminal for which permission to temporarily access the access group is registered are provided.
15. The mobile communication system according to claim 1, wherein said mobile communication system extends the access permit period when the access permit period expires during a phone call.

16. The mobile communication system according to claim 15, wherein said mobile communication system extends said access permit period by a given time, to until the mobile terminal shifts to an idle state, or to until the mobile terminal hands over to another base station.

17. The mobile communication system according to claim 1, wherein when the access permit period expires during a phone call, said mobile communication system causes the mobile terminal to hand over to another base station.

18. The mobile communication system according to claim 1, wherein when the access permit period expires during a phone call, said mobile communication system stops a call service after notifying the mobile terminal that the access permit period has expired.

19. The mobile communication system according to claim 1, wherein said mobile communication system provides a communications service in an open mode for a mobile terminal for which the access permit period has expired regarding a base station which provides a communications service in a closed mode for a mobile terminal which is registered with said access management device, and provides a communications service in the open mode for a mobile terminal which is not registered with said access management device.

20. A mobile communication system which includes a mobile terminal, a base station which carries out radio communications with said mobile terminal, and an access management device which manages access from said mobile terminal to said base station, and which, when an access group comprised of one or more mobile terminals and one or more base stations is registered with the access management device, grants a mobile terminal included in said access group permission to access to a base station included in the same access group, wherein when a predetermined condition is satisfied after permission to access said base station expires, said mobile communication system excludes the mobile terminal for which said permission to access said base station has expired from destinations to which a calling message is transmitted through a base station included in the same access group.
